newsitem.title: CHINA: China to issue gold coins to mark Army Day.
newsitem.headline: China to issue gold coins to mark Army Day.

text.p: The People's Bank of China will issue commemorative coins cast in gold and silver to mark the 70th anniversary on August 1 of the founding of China's People's Liberation Army (PLA), the People's Daily said on Wednesday.
The central bank has authorised the China Gold Coin Corp to mint 12,000 gold coins, each weighing half an ounce of pure gold, as well as 30,000 sets of the two one-ounce silver coins, it said.

The gold coin is stamped with an image of the late Chairman Mao Zedong at the Jingangshan Revolutionary Base, the first stronghold of China's communist-led armed forces in central Jiangxi province in the 1930s.

One of the silver coins depicts the Nanchang uprising, which took place on August 1, 1927, the day regarded as the founding of the PLA, while the third coin portrays three soldiers from the army, navy and air force.
